title: Which domain name is better: name.io or name.in? - Quora

response.answer_text: Part of your answer is right there: http://name.in is much better for your wallet than http://name.io.  The other part says ‘it depends on how you define better’. Better street cred in Silicon Valley? Sounds more local to someone in Bangalore? Sounds more local to someone in Mountain View? Ranks further up on Bing? Sounds nicer when you say it? (Imagine if LinkedIn were called LinkedIo. Or a betting company called http://BetAndW.in versus one called http://BetAndW.io.) Registrar has policies that you find better? WHOIS data comes in a more readable format? So the short version: your question doesn’t have enough information for a good answer, and there’s no one-size-fits-all answer.

Price shouldn't be the only reason for decision here, just like Philip Newton says. Think about what you will be using the name for and who your audience is. Some factors to consider: .IO tech startupstechnical companiesglobal audience (even though it is a country code)tech investorsetc..IN local audience (India)local businesslocal investorsetc.
